channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I’m a cybersecurity CEO who advises over 9,000 agencies and Sam Altman is wrong that the AI fraud crisis is coming—it’s already here
item.description: We may soon recognize a "Moore's Law"-style principle for AI that I call “Altman’s Law”: every 180 days, AI capabilities double.

item.title: UnitedHealth Group didn’t just miss earnings, it did something far worse
item.description: In less than a month, this corporate giant had lost more than half its value.

item.title: The Fed’s Powell said the phrase ‘downside risks’ six times in his press conference yesterday—is that bad news for tomorrow’s jobs number?
item.description: The jobs number (nonfarm payrolls, to give its technical name) is due out tomorrow. Expect stocks to react strongly if it comes in weak.

item.title: Powell didn’t just refuse to deliver a rate cut—he also hinted a raise could have been on the cards
item.description: Powell put a cat among the pigeons by suggesting he was minded to "look through" tariff-induced inflation by not increasing interest rates.

item.title: CFOs chart a course for crypto in corporate finance
item.description: Despite some concerns, finance chiefs are already making plans to adopt crypto, according to Deloitte.

item.title: Microsoft has added as much in market cap as Europe's top company is worth
Chinese regulator summons Nvidia over 'backdoor' security fears
Trump to penalize India for buying Russian oil. Here’s how much it purchases.
AB InBev shares suffer biggest drop since COVID as volumes tumble
Here's what's making small-cap stocks so toxic for investors right now
